qas.question: Where is much of the industry now located?

answers.text: nearby municipalities in the State of Mexico
a vast middle to upper-middle-class residential and business area.

context: <a2_0>North of the Historic Center<a2_0/>, Azcapotzalco and Gustavo A. Madero have important industrial centers and neighborhoods that range from established middle-class colonias such as Claveria and Lindavista to huge low-income housing areas that share hillsides with adjacent municipalities in the State of Mexico. In recent years much of northern Mexico City's industry has moved to <a0_0>nearby municipalities in the State of Mexico<a0_0/>. Northwest of Mexico City itself is Ciudad Satélite, <a1_0>a vast middle to upper-middle-class residential and business area.
